plan: In the upcoming rounds, I will test a mix of bidding strategies to maximize long-term profit. I will start with conservative bids around 70-80% of my value to gauge opponents' tendencies. I’ll also experiment with aggressive bids slightly above my estimated value when I suspect others may bid low. Additionally, I’ll observe patterns in previous rounds to adjust my bids accordingly, particularly focusing on the second-highest bids to optimize my winnings. I will also consider a low-ball strategy in a round to gather data on competitors’ risk appetites. Data collection will guide future bidding adjustments.

In the upcoming rounds, I will employ a mix of aggressive and conservative bidding strategies. Initially, I will bid close to my perceived value, adjusting based on observed bids from Andy and Charles. If I notice consistent high bids, I will adopt a more aggressive strategy, bidding slightly above my value to capture the prize. Conversely, if bids are low, I will play conservatively, bidding just below the expected second-highest bid. Additionally, I will analyze previous rounds to identify patterns in opponents' bidding behavior, allowing for more informed decisions in future rounds.
